sentence.Network_en: But there was a change in Gatsby that was simply confounding.
sentence.Network_cn: 但是盖茨比身上却发生了一种令人惶惑的变化.

sentence.Network_en: These analyses depend on a number of potentially confounding factors such as nonstomatal transpiration and temperature.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些分析取决于非气孔蒸腾和温度这样一些可能混淆的因素.

sentence.Network_en: He is good at confounding black and white and telling lies.
sentence.Network_cn: 他善于颠倒黑白,睁着眼睛说瞎话.

list.abs: 因此，这个变项便称为混淆变项（confounding variable）。 心理学的演进 ˙自我内省科学心理学之父Wilhelm Wundt（冯特）将内省  …
混淆变量(Confounding Variable)是指与自变量和因变量均相关的变量，该变量使自变量和因变量间产生虚假的关系(Meinert, 1986)。
partial carry 部分进位partial confounding 部分混区partial correlation 偏相关

然而,当把很多所说的的“混合因素”(confounding factor),譬如怙恃受教诲程度、移平易近配景等加以思量然后,现实上在双语环境中成长起来的小儿童其实不看出来进修.

entry.def: If someone or something confounds you, they make you feel surprised or confused, often by showing you that your opinions or expectations of them were wrong.

example.ex: He momentarily confounded his critics by his cool handling of the hostage crisis...
example.tran: 他对人质危机的冷静处理一时让批评者们惊讶不已。

example.ex: The choice of Governor may confound us all.
example.tran: 州长的选择可能会让我们所有人感到困惑。

means.word_mean: 1. that confounds or contradicts or confuses

auth_sentence.content: There are so many confounding factors that influence the results.

auth_sentence.content: Reactance can explain a lot of confounding behavior.
